etymologies: late Middle English; earliest use found in Jan van Ruusbroec's Treatise Perfection Sons of God. From post-classical Latin supersubstantialis surpassing all other substance (Vulgate: see note) from super- + substantialis

definitions: Chiefly . Above or transcending all substance or being; = superessential. Chiefly of God.
Above or transcending material substance; spiritual. Chiefly of the Eucharistic bread.

notes.text: In some uses with reference to the manna from heaven, which is seen as the Old Testament precursor of the Eucharist.
